Let's take our first look at the terminal screen.
When your terminal powers on, you'll notice that the first screen to display is the Sign On screen.
There's no need to touch a Sign On button first!
I'll show you how to sign on from this screen.
I'll simply enter my 4-digit Pass Number.
and touch Submit.
A sign on receipt prints automatically.
If there is a news message, it displays on the screen.
Touch OK
or to print the message, touch Print.
I'll touch OK
and the Home Screen displays.
'Let’s look at the Home Screen, starting with the top of the screen.
This is called the Status Bar and at this point, it is indicating the user is Signed In as a Clerk.
You can use this arrow to access a pull-down that shows activity during this session
and here you see the terminal is
Here to the left are your Sign Out, Help, and Lock buttons.
About the Help function, you'll notice that there is only one button.
Touch Help on any screen
and a pop-up displays information related to the screen you are on.
Touch OK once you read the help text,
or touch Print to print the information.
This next button is the Lock button.
The Lock button provides a one-touch locking feature that allows you to leave your terminal without signing off.
It is also recommended that you lock your terminal when cleaning your touch screen to avoid signing off your terminal or accidentally producing wagers.
Touch the Lock button
and your terminal displays the message PAUSED.
When you are ready to use the terminal again, just enter your pass number
and touch Submit.
Here is the Home Button and a new feature: Breadcrumb navigation.
As you move from screen
to screen,
the name of each screen in the path displays here.
So it's much easier to navigate between screens.
For example, for the Mail screen shown here, touch Services to return to the Services menu
or Home to return Home.
I'll touch Home.
Here, on the right side of the screen are the status buttons for Communications Activity,
the Printer,
Device Statuses,
and Mail.
Touch one of these buttons to view a particular device status.
I'll touch the Printer button
and the current status - Ready displays.
The Mail icon will indicate messages from the South Carolina Education Lottery and also acts as a shortcut button to the Mail screen.
The current Date and Time display here
and the current legal age to purchase lottery products display here for easy reference!
When you are done with your shift, simply touch the Sign-out button.
We'll cover the rest of the features of your new terminal application in the next lessons.
Let's move on!
